pros: Family oriented, easy job, easy overtime
The clients are amazing and sweet.
cons: It is a revolving door and current management picks favorites and treats the others like they're nothing. The pay is way too low and they will lie to get you in the door. Very short staffed.

review_title: If you love Management and Employee DRAMA, then this is your place. Lot's of turnover.
pros: If the company "made money" during the year from insurance claims, i.e. Medicaid, Medicare, Private, and/or fundraising, then employees received a "bonus" check at the end of the physical year. Note: this is a non-profit organization.  Flexible hours.  Caring employees.
cons: Lots of "creative bookkeeping" going on.  Lot's and lot's of drama by management and flows to employees.  Not a honest company dealing with insurance companies, the public, employees,  state officials, etc.  There is a lot of favoritism within the organization.

pros: Good benefits, person centered, flexible work environment, room to move up, promote from within,Aflack, BCBS health insurance, dental/eye plans, full time available quickly
cons: Not premium pay, usual staff squabbles, long hours, physically demanding at times, takes lots of patience and kindness, desire to work with clients with physical/mental disabilities

review_title: Looked down on, harassed, overworked, and underpaid

pros: Some of the individuals I worked with (not coworkers) made the job bearable
cons: Management talks to and treats employees like trash, no chance for advancement, no pay raises, backstabbing coworkers (TRUST NO ONE!!!), bootlickers are rewarded.

job_title: Consumer Support Specialist in Jasper, AL
pros: The consumers that you work for become family really quick!
cons: Not near enough pay for what you have to do. You give meds, you cook, you clean, you transport individuals everywhere, you do vehicle maintenance, you do therapy sessions, etc.... It's bs pay! A job with everything that this one entells should pay at least $10 per hour & have shift differential pay! Oh and the coordinators are heartless biotchs!

pros: If you go full time you get a Retirement from the state of Alabama
cons: low pay, dealing with Mentaly ill clients is agrevating and sometimes long Hours, with lots of paper work.
